name: ransom
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a large amount of money that is demanded in exchange for someone who has been taken prisoner, or sometimes for an animal: a ransom demand/note They demanded a huge ransom for the return of the little girl whom they had kidnapped. The gang held the racehorse to/for ransom.

a sum of money demanded in exchange for someone or something that has been taken: [ C ] The kidnappers demanded a huge ransom. [ U ] The man’s brother was held for ransom.
to free someone who has been taken away by paying money: The executive was ransomed for a million dollars.
